semantic_title: Coding All Documented Coexisting Conditions in Outpatient Settings
section_path: Section IV > J. Code all documented conditions that coexist

content.full_text: Code all documented conditions that coexist at the time of the encounter/visit and that require or affect patient care, treatment or management. Do not code conditions that were previously treated and no longer exist. However, history codes (categories Z80-Z87) may be used as secondary codes if the historical condition or family history has an impact on current care or influences treatment. (Evidence: pg no: 114, L79-L80)
content.summary: Requires coding of all coexisting conditions that impact current care while excluding resolved conditions, with provision for history codes when relevant (Evidence: pg no: 114, L79-L80)
key_concepts: Code all coexisting conditions affecting current care (Evidence: pg no: 114, L79-L80)
Must require or affect patient care, treatment, or management (Evidence: pg no: 114, L80)

Use history codes when historical conditions impact current care (Evidence: pg no: 114, L80)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code documented conditions that coexist and affect current care (Evidence: pg no: 114, L79-L80)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Do not code previously treated conditions that no longer exist (Evidence: pg no: 114, L80)
detailed_rules.explanation: Resolved conditions that were treated in the past but no longer exist should not be coded for current encounter (Evidence: pg no: 114, L80)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use history codes (Z80-Z87) when historical conditions impact current care (Evidence: pg no: 114, L80)
detailed_rules.explanation: History codes may be used as secondary codes when past conditions or family history influence current treatment decisions (Evidence: pg no: 114, L80)
